botanical_details.genus: Rosa can be deciduous or semi-evergreen shrubs or scrambling climbers, with usually thorny stems bearing compound pinnate leaves and solitary or clustered flowers. Flowers may be followed by showy red or purple fruits in some varieties.
botanical_details.horticultural_group: Shrub roses are large shrubs with usually thorny stems bearing large leaves and fragrant, single to double flowers in clusters in summer, and usually also in autumn

how_to_grow.cultivation: Grow in full sun with fertile, humus-rich, moist but well-drained soil. For best flowering apply a balanced fertiliser and mulch in late winter or early spring and a balanced fertiliser again in early summer. See rose cultivation
how_to_grow.propagation: For home use, propagate by hardwood cuttings in autumn or by chip budding in summer
how_to_grow.pruning: Pruning group 17 for a climbing rose and pruning group 20 for a shrub rose
how_to_grow.pests: May be susceptible to aphids, leafhoppers, glasshouse red spider mite, scale insects, caterpillars and rose leaf-rolling sawfly, large rose sawfly. Also rabbits and deer can cause damage
how_to_grow.diseases: May be susceptible to black spot, rose rust, powdery mildews and a downy mildew
